definition: Tao Yuanming (c. 365-427), Jin dynasty writer and poet
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming's poem which praised the autumn chrysanthemum revealed his noble character.
sentences.chinese: 陶渊明咏秋菊的诗篇显示出他高洁的人格。

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming's poem has the characteristics that the wine and the chrysanthemum are fragrant.
sentences.chinese: 陶渊明诗具有酒香与菊香的特点。

sentences.english: Although there are many different points about the thought origin of the Drinking- subject in Tao Yuanming's works.
sentences.chinese: 有关陶渊明涉酒诗文的思想渊源，历来说法不一。

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming's posies show very unique style and great and high attainments in citation.
sentences.chinese: 陶渊明诗文创作在艺术上具有独特风格和极高的造诣。

sentences.english: The emphasis of Xiao's Preface, however, remains Tao's personality.
sentences.chinese: 当然，萧统评论的重点，仍然在陶渊明的性格上。

sentences.english: Have you read the gleanings of Yuan-ming's poems?
sentences.chinese: 你看过陶渊明的诗集吗？

sentences.english: These exploitations established Tao Yuanming's high status as a topping poet in ancient times or today.
sentences.chinese: 这七大开拓，奠定了陶渊明古今一流诗人的崇高地位。

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming s tragic life lies on the break-down of lifes supporting point.
sentences.chinese: 陶渊明的人生悲剧在于其人生支撑点的失落。

sentences.english: The frustrations and misfortunes of Tao yuan - ming's whole life shaped his broad-minded and unconventional dignity.
sentences.chinese: 陶渊明一生历经坎坷，形成了旷达超远的人格境界。

sentences.english: This is Tao Yuanming affected by the possibility of Buddhist culture.
sentences.chinese: 这是陶渊明受到佛教文化影响的可能性。

sentences.english: I know that Tao Yunming had integrated himself with Nature.
sentences.chinese: 我知道陶渊明就是这样融入自然的。

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming was a scholar with a significant influence in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 陶渊明是中国历史上影响广泛而深远的文化人。

sentences.english: Tao is the first poet whose poems are almost concerning with wine.
sentences.chinese: 使诗中几乎篇篇有酒，确以陶渊明为第一人。

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming is the poet whose poems are selected most by Gushigui and valuated very highly.
sentences.chinese: 《古诗归》选录陶渊明诗作数量最多，且评价极高。

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming is the most famous and the admirable recluse in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 陶渊明是中国历史上最有名也是最值得钦佩的隐士。

sentences.english: He is now collecting material for a biography of Tao Yuanming.
sentences.chinese: 他正在为写陶渊明传记搜集材料。

definition: the Peach Blossom Spring, a hidden land of peace and prosperity/utopia
Tao Qian or Tao Yuanming 陶淵明|陶渊明 (c. 365-427), Jin dynasty writer and poet
shanshui poetry, genre of Classical Chinese poetry
Du Fu (712-770), great Tang dynasty poet

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Su Dongpo, another name for Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼 (1037-1101), northern Song writer and calligrapher
to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)
